definition: to taste a small amount/to sample
article/commodity/product/goods/kind/grade/rank/character/disposition/nature/temperament/variety/to taste sth/to sample/to criticize/to comment/to judge/to size up/fret (on a guitar or lute)
variant of 嘗|尝[chang2]/to taste/to experience

sentences.english: But alone you must drink life's gall .
sentences.chinese: 然而生活的苦汁你必须独自品尝。

sentences.english: So if you want to taste something good, just knock at the door.
sentences.chinese: 所以如果你想要品尝美味，就都试看吧。

sentences.english: But then this was one of the most remarkable restaurants I have ever eaten in.
sentences.chinese: 但这里是我曾品尝过的最出色的餐厅之一。

sentences.english: Secondly， I would like to try the local delicacies of Xi’an.
sentences.chinese: 其次，我希望品尝一下西安的地方美食。

sentences.english: Each of us dipped a finger into the mixture and sucked it.
sentences.chinese: 每个人都把手伸进怀子里沾一下并品尝。

sentences.english: You need to savour this wine to get its full flavor.
sentences.chinese: 要想充分体验这种酒的醇美，你需要慢慢地去品尝。

sentences.english: When the guest taste it, that is summative evaluation.
sentences.chinese: 当客人品尝的时候，就是总结评估。

sentences.english: It is very smooth (Churchill used to enjoy similar wines from nearby Melnik).
sentences.chinese: 丘吉尔也曾在附近的梅尔尼克品尝过类似的酒。

sentences.english: On the palate, the flavours open up unrestrainedly and not without a certain balance and roundness which overwhelm us.
sentences.chinese: 品尝的时候，味道持久地在口中蔓延开，平衡而圆润。

sentences.english: Can also taste the meal of the Yi family tradition flavor.
sentences.chinese: 还可品尝彝家风味的饭菜。

sentences.english: You can go to Liouhe Night Market for the real local food.
sentences.chinese: 你可以到六合夜市去品尝本地料理。

sentences.english: Tasted the bitter taste of dying ambitions.
sentences.chinese: 品尝垂死的雄心那苦涩的滋味。

sentences.english: We strode down the open corridors together in our solitary fancy tasting artichokes.
sentences.chinese: 我们一起来到宽敞的过道在寂寞中奇想品尝洋蓟。

sentences.english: I appreciated that I could grab good Mexican food at the swim-up bar.
sentences.chinese: 我和高兴的品尝了上游酒吧所做的美味的墨西哥餐。

sentences.english: Next was a tour and tasting session at a winery making sickeningly sweet lychee wine.
sentences.chinese: 接下来的环节是到一家荔枝酒厂参观和品尝。

sentences.english: It would be a pity if you left without tasting it.
sentences.chinese: 你要是不品尝一下就走，那将是一大憾事。

definition: to enjoy (i.e. have the use or benefit of)
to eat one's fill/to have a good meal
to chew on a large slab (idiom); a large mouthful is hard to chew/to tuck into a great meal
variant of 嘗|尝[chang2]/to taste/to experience
dilettante/amateur/to dabble in/to flirt with (a topic)
dilettante/amateur/to dabble in/to flirt with (a topic)
